title: Analog Source: Letterpress in an American Design Education (St Bride Library)
content:
Submitted by [Miss Tiffany](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103131036/http:/typophile.com/user/108 "View user profile.") : 25.Jun.2009 12.07pm 

\* An illustrated talk at St Bride Library  
\* Tuesday 30 June 2009 at 7pm  
\* In the Bridewell Hall, St Bride Foundation  
\* Admission £7; concessions £5; Friends of St Bride £3  
\* Pay on the door

Many examples of student work from the Visual Communications Program at  
the University of Delaware are intended to insight a lively conversation  
about the value of letterpress in contemporary design education. Ashley  
John Pigford and William Deering will speak about the Raven Press at the  
University of Delaware as a place of unbridled experimentation and  
phenomenological education.

Professor Ashley John Pigford is an artist, designer, musician and  
educator who works across a wide range of art and design media including  
video, sound, installation, performance, sculpture, micro-electronics  
and letterpress. His current employment as Assistant Professor of Visual  
Communications and Co-director of Raven Press at the University of  
Delaware is paired with an active art/design studio practice. Ashley  
received his MFA in Graphic Design from the Rhode Island School of  
Design in 2006 after a successful career as a proprietor of graphic  
design in Los Angeles, CA.

Professor William Deering is the coordinator of the Visual  
Communications program, teaches photographic design, Co-directs the  
letter press facility Raven Press and the London Study abroad program in  
the Department of Art, University of Delaware. His many awards over the  
past 30 years have included: The American Institute of Graphic Arts, The  
Art Directors Club of New York, Communication Arts, Print, The One Club,  
and the Society of Publication Designers.
